name: Feastie Sip and Snack Festival
description: A unique all-ages food and drink festival bringing together perfect harmony of elevated craft cocktails, beers and natural wines. Sample diverse snack food offerings from local, BIPOC and female-owned small businesses. Live Music, DJs, games and entertainment. Dogs welcome! There will be a specially curated dog area with local dog vendors.

name: Firsts on Front Street Community Event
description: Learn how Toronto became Canada’s largest city. Explore its historic downtown, the St. Lawrence area and discover the people, places, and events that helped build this multicultural metropolis.

name: BIG on Bloor
description:
The 19th year of the BIG on Bloor Festival returns with in-person pedestrian takeover of car-free Bloordale!

Celebrating community magic, creativity and diversity through arts and culture, providing opportunities to local disenfranchised artists and showcasing the small businesses that make Bloordale so amazing.

This year, we will explore the theme of bizarre; a celebration of the delightfully peculiar aspects of local culture, artistry, and community life, through workshops and installations led by local BIPOC artists, presenting conversations with their relationship to the individual, cultural oddities and how both are necessary for a healthy creative community.

name: 23rd TD Festival of South Asia 2025

location.name: Gerrard Street East between Coxwell Avenue and Glenside Avenue in Toronto, Ontario, Canada

description:
Come down to Gerrard India Bazaar to enjoy the food, drinks, entertainment, and celebration! TD Festival of South Asia returns for 2 jam packed days of family fun activities, food, shopping, live entertainment and more! Be sure to bring the kids to our Kids Zone! Check out these 3 segments in the Kids Zone: 

- Junior Ventures: an exclusive marketplace for KidPrenurs
- Rising Star talent competition 
- Pet Contest Pre-registration is required. 
Open to children up to 12 years. See post for details!

name: Summer Eco-Day at Scarborough Museum
description:
Join Scarborough Museum and Scarborough Environmental Association for a free community event celebrating sustainability, nature, and local environmental action! Activities will include a bike repair and clothing swap - watch this space for further details to be announced.

SEA is a grass roots not for profit organization that aims to bring communities together to advocate for the environment through programs that encourage socializing and community service. They run everything from repair cafes to social sewing, bird watching and more.

name: 2025 The Selfish Market
description:
Where “being selfish" is a good thing. We’re all about celebrating yourself without the guilt trip. Interact with talented local artists, indulge in delicious foods and support local vendors all at the same time!

We will be hosting an all-day event featuring: local businesses which is the heart of our initiative, we aim to curate impactful small businesses, live performances with returning emerging artists and other show-stoppers, small daily activations, and door prize baskets!

name: Black Creek Community Farm Festival
description:
Celebrating its 13th year, Black Creek Community Farm's Annual Farm Festival is a community staple as it celebrates community and urban agriculture which includes a day of fun activities for families to enjoy.
Enjoy an exciting lineup of community partners, vendors, food, crafts, games, activities and live performances!

A City of Toronto Cultural Hotspot Signature Project.

name: Community Environment Day at Regent Park (Oak St.)
description:
Join Councillor Moise (Ward 13) and the City of Toronto to help reduce the amount of waste going to landfill. Drop off household items for donation, electronics for reuse or recycling and household hazardous waste for proper disposal. 

Pick up free bagged compost while supplies last and kitchen catchers for organics ($7 each – cash, debit and credit accepted).
